2
OWL and SWRL
Named Classes (I)
An ontology contains classes – indeed, the main building blocks of
an OWL ontology are classes.
An empty ontology contains one class called Thing.
OWL classes are interpreted as sets of individuals or sets of
objects. The class Thing is the class that represents the set
containing all individuals.
Because of this all classes are subclasses of Thing.
speaker: SYSTEM
